data.title: Atom package dependency add Unix utils
data.body: I am interested in writing an Atom package that may depend on and call a Unix util, specifically a2ps: https://www.gnu.org/software/a2ps/. Is this possible? Thanks.

data.title: Update languages
data.body:
Highlights:
- Many languages got improved modeline support, thanks to @Alhadis
- @Ingramz contributed to some nice quality-of-life fixes
- @bgriffith continues to work on JSDoc support
- language-hyperlink supports unicode links again, thanks to @viddo
- Continued CSS and SCSS overhauls by @esdoppio, as well as major function improvements in Sass by @idbartosz
- Improved header file highlighting thanks to @hgdsraj
- Continued YAML improvements, by myself

This PR turned out a little larger than expected, thanks to procrastination.

data.title: 1.10 releases
Atom crashes on macOS Sierra 10.12.1 Beta; requires reinstall
data.body:
This is the second time that I'll need to reinstall Atom on my computer.
Attempting to uncheck "install beta updates" from Mac App Store to see whether that will make a difference in the future.
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?

atom . returns "LSOpenURLsWithRole() failed for the application /Applications/Atom.app with error -10810."

atom . --safe returns "LSOpenURLsWithRole() failed for the application /Applications/Atom.app with error -10810."
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?

Unable to tell; cannot find atom version as atom --version in Terminal does not work. Opening Atom from mission control does not work either.
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?

Clearing window state did not work; returned problem report.
Reset to factory defaults did not work; returned problem report upon reboot.
No links in apm links (after factory default reset)
Unable to run rest of checks as they require running instance of Atom.
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?

Checked, no problems listed with opening Atom.
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?

Problem is with Atom, pretty sure I am in correct repository.
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

Performed cursory search. Bug is not reported.

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

Atom unable to open. Atom crashes and Problem Report opens.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Update to macOS 10.12.1 Beta.
2. Install latest version of Atom (assuming Atom has been syncing changes with stable build upon reboot).
3. Navigate to folder and type in Terminal "atom ."

**Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen]

Atom opens with folders in left-hand side.

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]

Atom crashes and Apple creates a crash report.

1.8 releases

1.5 releases
Atom built-in apps are not using npm3 structure
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

Even though npm3 has been enforced on external apps, Atom built-in apps are not using this structure yet!  
I downloaded atom-windows.zip (Tried with both [Beta](https://github.com/atom/atom/releases/download/v1.11.0-beta5/atom-windows.zip)  and [stable](https://github.com/atom/atom/releases/download/v1.10.2/atom-windows.zip)), when I extracted this zip file, the packages inside “resources” folder had long chain of sub-directories, the path-size of these sub-directories range upto 206 characters, one example of such path is as follows

```
Atom\app-1.10.2\resources\app\apm\node_modules\npm\node_modules\request\node_modules\har-validator\node_modules\is-my-json-valid\node_modules\generate-object-property\node_modules\is-property\is-property.js
```

Since Windows MAX_PATH is restricted to 260 characters, we cannot extract Atom or relocate existing installation of Atom onto a location where the path size is more than 54 characters (260-206=54) 
### Versions

Aforementioned issue exists on both 1.10.2 (Current stable release) and 1.11.0-beta5 (Latest beta version)

### Description

The Documentation link from the Help menu "https://flight-manual.atom.io/" is not loading on Firefox. It is reported as being incorrectly configured.

Firefox message: "Your connection is not secure. The owner of flight-manual.atom.io has configured their website improperly. To protect your information from being stolen, Firefox has not connected to this website."
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open Help Menu
2. Click Documentation item

**Expected behavior:** Should be directing to HTTP version of light-manual.atom.io

**Actual behavior:** Being directed to https://flight-manual.atom.io/ which seems incorrectly configured.
### Versions

Atom 1.10.2
Firefox 49.0.1

data.title: backup progress
Opening file through default file association when Atom had been started manually opens second instance
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [ ] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?

cannot use safe mode with this use case
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [ ] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?

cannot use these tips with this use case.
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?

nothing applicable to be find here.
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

I have Atom set as the default program for files with extension ".sql". If I double-click a .sql file in Windows Explorer _while Atom is not yet running_, Atom opens correctly with the file. If I click another ".sql" file, that file is correctly opened in the same Atom window in a new tab. This works the same if I right-click and select "Open with Atom".

Now I shut down Atom, and manually open Atom (Windows key -> Atom). Atom opens with the last session state. If I now double-click an SQL file in Windows Explorer, _a second Atom instance_ opens with the file. If on the other hand I right-click->Open with Atom, the file opens in the existing Atom window in a new tab.

When double-clicking a file while an Atom instance was previously started manually (Windows key -> Atom), that file should open in the existing window, not open a new Atom instance.

Btw. the same issue happens when trying to open an SQL email attachment from Outlook. If Atom was previously started manually, this will open a new Atom instance with the file. It does not re-use the existing instance.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open Atom manually, eg Start menu->GitHub, Inc -> Atom
2. Open Windows Explorer
3. Locate a file who's extension has been associated with Atom
4. Double-click that file

**Expected behavior:** The file from (4) opens in the existing Atom window

**Actual behavior:** A new Atom instance opens with the file. Now there are 2 Atom windows/instances
### Versions
- Atom 1.10.2
- Electron 0.37.8
- Chrome 49.0.2623.75
- Node 5.10.0
- Windows 7 Professional SP1

You can get this information from executing `atom --version` and `apm --version` at the command line. Also, please include the OS and what version of the OS you're running.

data.title: Cannot type opening curly quotes on Mac
data.body:
### Description

Due to (apparently) how the keybinding engine works and the (imo ludicrous) re-mapping of option-[ and option-] to tab-switching (using the option key alone as a command key is a terrible idea on Mac computers), it is impossible to type a ‘ or “ character. Being a text editor, not being able to type a character in the normal way is a pretty big limitation.

Even worse, if you unbind the mentioned keys, nothing happens at all when they are typed.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open a new or existing text file.
2. Try to type an opening single or double curly quote (option-] or option-[).

**Expected behavior:**
The expected character should be typed.

**Actual behavior:**
A list of open tabs appears, or if the keys are unmapped, nothing at all happens.
### Versions

Atom    : 1.10.2
Electron: 0.37.8
Chrome  : 49.0.2623.75
Node    : 5.10.0

apm  1.12.5
npm  3.10.5
node 4.4.5
python 2.7.10
git 2.8.4

Mac OS X El Capitan 10.11.6 (15G1004)

data.title: The Atom has crashed when open one big text file
data.body:
### Description

I have a big text file. I could use sublime open it that will take few seconds. But there will occurred an crashed error when i open it with Atom. By the way, the size of file is 16M!
